objects.name: Incorrect Subtitled Speech Reframes Context
objects.description:
Subtitles added to content to support viewers in understanding what was said by an individual can misrepresent what was said, which is difficult for viewers to detect when watching a speaker of another language, or videos without an audio track.

To make this assertion, analysts need to confirm that what was said was meaningfully different to the subtitles provided for the speech (i.e. not nit-picking minor translation issues, but changes which make changes to the context of what was said).

Analysts may require bilingual speakers to identify mistranslations. They can also search for the original media to search for original subtitles.
